medical_history.chief_complaint: Lifelong painful ulcerations on the legs due to livedoid vasculopathy
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ulcerations recurred since age 12 years, becoming increasingly frequent and continuous for the 2 years before presentation. They were occasionally precipitated by trauma but mostly developed spontaneously from small 'pink spots' that broke down into larger ulcerations persisting for 2 to 12 months. The ulcers caused severe pain, disrupting sleep and daily activities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Lifelong history of painful ulcerations; diagnoses of vasculitis, vasculopathy, cryoglobulinemia, and cutaneous polyarteritis nodosa; no personal or family history of deep venous thrombosis or miscarriages.
medical_history.social_history: Received hormone replacement therapy for several years before the onset of symptoms.
